summary: This is an email from a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor regarding a draft opposition to a hearing in the Epstein case. The email indicates coordination on legal strategy and timing related to an upcoming interview.

persons.name: Brass
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a draft legal document related to the Epstein case proceedings.

events.title: Government Files Opposition to Hearing
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office prepared and approved a draft opposition to a hearing in the Epstein case.

events.title: Upcoming Interview
events.description: An interview is scheduled to occur, and the filing of the legal opposition is being timed to wait until after this interview is completed.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein case.
It shows coordination on legal strategy, with a supervisor ('Brass') signing off on a draft opposition to a hearing.
The filing of the legal document was being deliberately timed to occur after an unspecified interview was concluded.
